questions.text: Identify the marked structure

A patient is brought to the OPD by his wife complaining about difficulty in expressing emotions and not taking part in daily activities. On examination, resting tremors and rigidity are noted. Given the possible diagnosis, which part of the brain is affected in this patient?

A male patient presents with sensory loss and weakness of limbs for 3 months. He also has angular stomatitis. On examination, there is loss of proprioception, vibration sensations, UMN type of lower limb weakness, and absent ankle reflex. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Subacute combined degeneration of cord

questions.text: A 78-year-old woman presents with a progressive decline in daily activity. She gives a history of convulsions and visual hallucinations. She does not talk to anyone and keeps looking at the sky. Pathological examination shows the presence of Lewy bodies within the neurons. What is the most probable diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: It's diameter is less than left coronary artery

options.label: B
options.text: It arises from the anterior aortic sinus

options.label: C
options.text: It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

options.label: D
options.text: Right conal artery is it's first branch

questions.correct_answer: C. It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

A 21-year-old null gravida caucasian patient presented with a 15-month history of amenorrhea, bifrontal headache, and photophobia. Examination revealed general physical, neurologic, and ophthalmoscopic findings with normal visual fields. A pelvic examination revealed normal external genitalia, nulliparous cervix and uterus, and bilateral cystic ovarian masses measuring 8 cm in diameter on the right and 4 cm on the left. Endocrine evaluation revealed an elevated serum prolactin in the range of 48 to 50 ng/ml. This situation was related with mass in the following area of the below image

Which of the following is incorrect option

options.label: A
options.text: A & B are not having any nuclei but C is having nuclei

options.label: B
options.text: B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa

options.label: C
options.text: Chief sensory nucleus of trigeminal nerve is situated in D & Corticospinal tract passes through E

options.label: D
options.text: XIII cranial nerve is situated near A, XII cranial nerve is attached between E & F while IX, X & XI cranial nerve are attached behind F

questions.correct_answer: B. B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa
questions.explanation: Ans. B) B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa

questions.text: V th ventricle of the brain is related to

options.label: A
options.text: Lesion at C will result in Paralytic agitans & lesion at F will result in disturbance in Papez circuit

options.label: B
options.text: B is considered as 5 th lobe of brain & F is considered a part of 6 th lobe of brain

options.label: C
options.text: A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system

options.label: D
options.text: D is the example of largest commissural fibre & E is afferent for the mammilary body

questions.correct_answer: C. A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system

A 45-year-old woman is being examined as a candidate for cosmetic breast surgery. The surgeon notes that both of her breasts sag considerably. Which structure has most likely become stretched to result in this condition?

A 48-year-old female court stenographer is admitted to the orthopedic clinic with symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome, with which she has suffered for almost a year. Which muscles most typically become weakened in this condition?

Laboratory studies in the outpatient clinic on a 24-year-old female included assessment of circulating blood chemistry. Which of the following arteries is most likely at risk during veni puncture at the cubital fossa?

A 45-year-old male is admitted to the hospital with a painful arm after a “strongest man in the world” contest. Physical examination gives evidence of a rupture of the long tendon of the biceps brachii as shown in image. Which of the following is the most likely location of the rupture?

options.label: C
options.text: Junction with the short head of the biceps muscle

questions.text: A 45-year-old male is treated at the hospital after he fell from his bicycle. Radiographic examination reveals fractures both of the tibia and the fibula. On physical examination the patient has a foot drop, but normal eversion as shown in image. Which of the following nerves is most likely injured?

A 32-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department after an injury to his foot while playing football with his college friends. An MRI examination reveals multiple tendinous tears as shown in image. Which of the following bones is associated with the muscle tears?

A 49-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department with a cold and pale foot. Physical examination reveals that the patient suffers from peripheral vascular disease and his popliteal artery is occluded and no pulse is felt upon palpation. What is the landmark to feel the pulse of the femoral artery?

During cardiac catheterization of a 6-year-old child, the radiologist notes that the contrast medium released into the arch of the aorta is visible immediately in the left pulmonary artery. What is the most likely explanation for this finding?

A 17-year-old girl is admitted to the hospital with severe dyspnea. Physical examination reveals that the patient is suffering from an asthma attack, with associated bronchospasm. Which of the following nerves is responsible for the innervation of the bronchial smooth muscle cells?

A 3-year-old male who fell from a tree complains of severe pain over the right side of his chest because of a rib fracture at the midaxillary line. He is admitted to the hospital due to his difficulty breathing. Radiographic and physical examinations reveal atelectasis, resulting from the accumulation of blood in his pleural space and resulting hemothorax. What is the most likely the source of bleeding to cause the hemothorax?
Fusion of the caudal portions of the kidneys during embryonic development is most likely to result in which of the following congenital conditions?

A 54-year-old male is admitted to the emergency department with severe upper abdominal pain. Gastroscopy reveals a tumor in the antrum of the stomach. A CT scan is ordered to evaluate lymphatic drainage of the stomach. Which of the following lymph nodes is most likely to be involved in a malignancy of the stomach?

A 42-year-old patient is admitted to the hospital after suffering a ruptured spleen in a skiing accident. Physical examination reveals intense pain that radiates to the region of the left shoulder, presumably due to irritation of the diaphragm. Which of the following signs best describes this condition?

A 68-year-old man is admitted to the hospital due to severe back pain. Radiographic examination reveals severe osteoporosis of the vertebral column, with crush fractures of vertebrae L4 and L5. Which of the following parts of the vertebrae are most likely to be fractured in this patient?

A 34-year-old woman is admitted to the emergency department after a car crash. Radiographic examination reveals a whiplash injury in addition to hyperextension of her cervical spine. Which of the following ligaments will most likely be injured?

A 55-year-old man is admitted to the hospital after an injury sustained at work in a factory. He presents with severe scalp lacerations, which were sutured. After three days the wound is inflammed, swollen, and painful. Between which tissue layers is the infection most likely located?

options.label: C
options.text: The dense connective tissue and the aponeurosis

options.label: D
options.text: The dense connective tissue and the skin

questions.correct_answer: B. The aponeurosis and the periosteum
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The aponeurosis and the periosteum

questions.text: 54-year-old man was admitted to the emergency department after he was struck by an automobile. Radiographic examination revealed a fracture through the crista galli of the anterior cranial fossa, resulting in slow, local bleeding. Which of the following is the most likely source of bleeding?

options.label: B
options.text: The great cerebral vein of Galen

Your patient has a stooped posture, shuffling gait, and a tremor in the fingers at rest. Which part of the brain will show neuronal degeneration?

options.label: A
options.text: A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

options.label: C
options.text: Drooping of the corner of the mouth on the left

questions.correct_answer: A. A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg
